p: Influenza virus NS1 suppresses IFN synthesis through several different mechanisms [ 51– 54] ( Figure 3). First, it limits the pretranscriptional induction of IFN by forming a complex with RIG-I and limiting its signaling [ 55, 56]. Second, it directly limits the extent of the antiviral state by inhibiting PKR by sequestering dsRNA and by forming a complex with PKR avoiding its activation [ 57, 58]. Third, it inhibits mRNA maturation by interfering with the effector domain of the 3′-end processing [ 59]. Finally, NS1 activates phosphatidyl-inositol-3 kinases (PI3K) which can delay apoptosis of infected cells [ 60].
